resources.string: View Tutorial
What is Open Tenure ?

• To facilitate community recording of tenure rights using crowd sourcing approach 
• Mobile Device software for field capture and display of tenure rights and associated reference map imagery 
• Web based Community Server for community moderation of tenure claims community accessible
Claim Details

Home page with the latest news and the links to access 
 Open Tenure Community Web Site as well as FLOSS SOLA Web Site and other news sources

Map viewer highlighting the Community Area of interest 
 (notice that only parcels located inside this area can be uploaded to the Community Server)

Shows the list of persons making the claim on behalf of others or themselves 
 
 Select one element of the list to edit details about the person 
 including name, date of birth, gender, ID details and photo 
 
 ....or....

Shows the list of Claims 
 
 Each claim has a lifecycle and transition to different states as the claim is processed

A claim can be selected from the list to enter/see its details and mark up the extent of the tenure rights 
 
 Claims lifecycle is reported by the status legend: 
• L = Lodged 
• U = Uploaded/Unmoderated 
• C = Challenged 
• M = Moderated 
• R = Rejected 
• W = Withdrawn 
 
 Click on the Blue Arrow Icon to upload the claim to the Community Server 
 
 Click on the red Cross Icon to remove the claim from the list 
 
 ....or....
\n Details about Claim including name, tenure right, land use, date that right started and any notes about the claim

Maps the extent of the tenure rights using the mobile device and the downloaded map imagery assisted with GPS positions provided by mobile device. 
 
 When complete a map of the claim can be generated and added to the claim

Long press on the map to create a new marker 
 
 Tap on an existing marker to edit it 
 
 Long press on an existing marker to drag it around

List of Documents attached to the claim 
 
 A document can be selected from the list to edit/see its details

Click the attach icon to attach an existing file 
 
 Click the camera icon to take a photo to be attached to the claim

Adjacencies information can be entered for each cardinal point of the claim location 
 
 Adjacient claims information will be automatically retrieved and shown by the application
Lists the challenges rised against the claim

Shows the shares of the claim 
 
 A share can be selected from the list to 
 edit/see its value 
 add/remove owners 
 
 Click on Add Icon to add new shares of the claim

Click on Lock Icon to Encrypt local data 
 
 Click on the list of items in action bar menu to be able to access: 
• "Settings" to configure Community Server and Geoserver URL 
• "View Tutorial" to see again this tutorial introduction

Click on Center Icon to center the map on your position 
 
 Click on Download Claims Icon to download claims of the 
 visualized area from the Community Server 
 
 Select the type of map viewer from the action bar menu
\n Click on Add Person Icon to add a new person and enter details

Click on Add Claim Icon to add new claim and enter its details 
 
 Click on Login/Logout Icon to be enabled/disabled to edit and upload your claims

Click on Save Icon to save claim details 
 
 Click on Export Icon to create a compress zip file of the claim 
 
 Click on Print Icon to create a printable claim form

Click on Rotate Icon to rotate the map using the device compass 
 
 Click on Center Icon to center the map to your position 
 
 Click on Attach Snapshot Icon to attach a snapshot of the claim map

You must now initialize the application. 
 
 How to???

This icon allows initializing the application. 
 
 At the moment, the configuration is ready to join the Open Tenure demo community. 
 
 If you want to join another community, properly set your community server URL in the setting menu before initializing. 
 
 Every time you need to change community: 
 
 1) clear data for Open Tenure in the android apps settings 
 
 2) set the community server URL in the Open Tenure settings 
 
 3) initialize the application

..and now.. 
 
 ENJOY USING OPEN TENURE!! 

 you can view again this tutorial at any time selecting "View Tutorial" from the action bar menu
